qas.question: Which languages used the Phags-pa script?
How well did the Mongol Emperors know Chinese?

answers.text: could not master written Chinese, but they could generally converse well
could not master written Chinese, but they could generally converse well

qas.question: The mother of which emperor was a concubine?
Which languages rejected the Phags-pa script?
How poorly did the Mongol Emperors know spoken Chinese?
The father of which emperor was a concubine?

context: Since its invention in <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>1269<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, the 'Phags-pa script, a unified script for spelling <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>Mongolian, Tibetan, and Chinese<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> languages, was preserved in the court until the end of the dynasty. Most of the Emperors <a2_0><a2_1>could not master written Chinese, but they could generally <b7_0>converse <a2_2>well<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> in the language<b7_0/>. The Mongol custom of long standing quda/marriage alliance with Mongol clans, the Onggirat, and the Ikeres, kept the imperial blood purely Mongol until the reign of <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>Tugh Temur<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>, whose mother was a Tangut concubine. The Mongol Emperors had built large palaces and pavilions, but some still continued to live as nomads at times. Nevertheless, a few other Yuan emperors actively sponsored cultural activities; an example is <b8_0>Tugh Temur<b8_0/> (<a4_0><a4_1><b9_0>Emperor <a4_2>Wenzong<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>), who wrote poetry, painted, read Chinese classical texts, and ordered the compilation of books.
